title: Drow (monster attribute)
data:
**Drow** is a [monster attribute](/wiki/Monster_attribute "Monster attribute") in some variants of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that indicates when a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") should be considered dark elven. As drow are related to elves, they are also considered [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)").

In the variants that it appears in, the drow attribute generally determines the appropriate [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") for drow monsters and [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") characters, as well as what constitutes [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism") and same-race [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") for drow characters.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [1.1 SLASH'EM racial equipment](#SLASH.27EM_racial_equipment)

- [2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

  - [2.1 List of dNetHack monsters](#List_of_dNetHack_monsters)
  - [2.2 dNetHack racial equipment](#dNetHack_racial_equipment)

- [3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.1 SpliceHack racial equipment](#SpliceHack_racial_equipment)

- [4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

  - [4.1 List of EvilHack monsters](#List_of_EvilHack_monsters)
  - [4.2 EvilHack racial equipment](#EvilHack_racial_equipment)

## SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), only the [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Drow (SLASH'EM)") monster and [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#SLASH.27EM "Drow (starting race)") [heroes](/wiki/Hero "Hero") are considered to be drow - drow characters are always chaotic, since [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") in SLASH'EM can be lawful or neutral. Unlike later variants, drow lack distinct undead forms.

All the information in this section also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### SLASH'EM racial equipment

The following objects are considered dark elven items:

- [dark elven dagger](/wiki/Dark_elven_dagger_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven dagger (SLASH'EM)")
- [dark elven short sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)")
- [dark elven bow](/wiki/Dark_elven_bow_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven bow (SLASH'EM)")
- [dark elven arrow](/wiki/Dark_elven_arrow_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven arrow (SLASH'EM)")
- [dark elven mithril-coat](/wiki/Dark_elven_mithril-coat "Dark elven mithril-coat")

## dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), drow monsters are denoted with the `MA_DROW` flag, and have far more detailed attributes than in other variants.

Drow monsters have a +2 bonus to [hit dice](/wiki/Hit_dice "Hit dice") size and gain [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") or [monster level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") 4. Drow monsters that are not [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") can invoke the darkness to cover the area around them, which darkens rooms and otherwise creates unlit squares in a 5-square radius around the user - a [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#dNetHack "Drow (starting race)") hero can use this ability via the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") for 10 [power](/wiki/Power "Power").

Nearly all drow monsters, including heroes but excluding any of the [Changed](/wiki/Changed "Changed"), are generated as belonging to a particular "house" - this can usually be determined by the house symbols engraved on any [signet rings](/index.php?title=Signet_ring\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Signet ring (page does not exist)") and heavy droven armor that they generate with. Drow from houses that are aligned against each other will be mutually hostile, and will be hostile towards a drow hero of an opposing faction - conversely, drow of the same house, or of different houses that are aligned with each other, will be peaceful towards each other and towards drow heroes of allied factions.

Drow monsters gain a +1 bonus to [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") when [throwing](/wiki/Throw "Throw") [Sickle Moon](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Sickle_Moon "DNetHack artifacts"), and gain a +1 bonus to the precision damage multiplier for firing projectiles from [droven crossbows](/wiki/Droven_crossbow "Droven crossbow"). Drow monsters cannot cast directed spells at a character that is either non-drow and standing on an [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth_\(dNetHack\) "Elbereth (dNetHack)") [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving"), or else is a drow and standing on a [Lolth](/wiki/Lolth_\(dNetHack\) "Lolth (dNetHack)") engraving with the conditions for its use met. Drow spellcasters that cast the [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") will instead use [a variation of the spell](/wiki/DNetHack_monster_spells "DNetHack monster spells") that summons [spiders](/wiki/Spider "Spider").

### List of dNetHack monsters

The monsters listed below are considered to be drow:

- h [changed](/wiki/Changed "Changed")

- h [clairvoyant changed](/index.php?title=Clairvoyant_changed\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Clairvoyant changed (page does not exist)")

- C [drider](/wiki/Drider_\(dNetHack\) "Drider (dNetHack)")

- 9 [Iksh'na Deva](/index.php?title=Iksh%27na_Deva\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Iksh'na Deva (page does not exist)")

- C [sprow](/wiki/Sprow "Sprow")

- C [priestess of Ghaunadaur](/wiki/Priestess_of_Ghaunadaur "Priestess of Ghaunadaur")

- C [Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion](/index.php?title=Blibdoolpoolp%27s_mindgraven_champion\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion (page does not exist)")

- C [mendicant sprow](/index.php?title=Mendicant_sprow\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mendicant sprow (page does not exist)")

- C [mendicant drider](/index.php?title=Mendicant_drider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mendicant drider (page does not exist)")

- H [warrior changed](/wiki/Warrior_changed "Warrior changed")

- H [twitching four-armed changed](/index.php?title=Twitching_four-armed_changed\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Twitching four-armed changed (page does not exist)")

- L [dokkalfar eternal matriarch](/wiki/Dokkalfar_eternal_matriarch "Dokkalfar eternal matriarch")

- M [drow mummy](/wiki/Drow_mummy_\(dNetHack\) "Drow mummy (dNetHack)")

- M [hedrow zombie](/wiki/Hedrow_zombie "Hedrow zombie")

- @ [drow](/index.php?title=Drow_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")

- @ [drow captain](/index.php?title=Drow_captain\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow captain (page does not exist)")

- @ [hedrow warrior](/wiki/Hedrow_warrior "Hedrow warrior")

- @ [hedrow wizard](/wiki/Hedrow_wizard "Hedrow wizard")

- @ [drow matron](/wiki/Drow_matron "Drow matron")

- @ [hedrow blademaster](/wiki/Hedrow_blademaster "Hedrow blademaster")

- @ [embraced drowess](/wiki/Embraced_drowess "Embraced drowess")

- @ [shadowsmith](/index.php?title=Shadowsmith\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shadowsmith (page does not exist)")

- @ [mindless thrall](/wiki/Mindless_thrall "Mindless thrall")

- @ [Eclavdra](/wiki/Eclavdra "Eclavdra")

- @ [Mother](/index.php?title=Mother_\(quest_leader\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mother (quest leader) (page does not exist)")

- @ [drow novice](/wiki/Drow_novice "Drow novice")

- @ [Seyll Auzkovyn](/wiki/Seyll_Auzkovyn "Seyll Auzkovyn")

- @ [Daruth Xaxox](/wiki/Daruth_Xaxox "Daruth Xaxox")

- @ [Blibdoolpoolp, graven-into-flesh](/index.php?title=Blibdoolpoolp,_graven-into-flesh\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blibdoolpoolp, graven-into-flesh (page does not exist)")

- @ [A'gone](/wiki/A%27gone "A'gone")

- @ [A'salom](/wiki/A%27salom "A'salom")

- @ [drow matron-mother](/wiki/Drow_matron-mother "Drow matron-mother")

- @ [hedrow master-wizard](/wiki/Hedrow_master-wizard "Hedrow master-wizard")

- @ [drow alienist](/wiki/Drow_alienist "Drow alienist")

- @ [Gromph](/wiki/Gromph "Gromph")

- @ [Dantrag](/wiki/Dantrag "Dantrag")

- @ [stjarna-alfr](/index.php?title=Stjarna-alfr\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Stjarna-alfr (page does not exist)")

- @ [Sister T'eirastra](/index.php?title=Sister_T%27eirastra\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sister T'eirastra (page does not exist)")

- @ [Pen'a mendicant](/index.php?title=Pen%27a_mendicant\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pen'a mendicant (page does not exist)")

- @ [Y-cultist](/index.php?title=Y-cultist\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist (page does not exist)")

- @ [Y-cultist fighter](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_fighter\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist fighter (page does not exist)")

- @ [Y-cultist wizard](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_wizard\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist wizard (page does not exist)")

- @ [Y-cultist matron](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_matron\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist matron (page does not exist)")

- @ [Y-cultist patron](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_patron\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist patron (page does not exist)")

- @ [anulo](/index.php?title=Anulo\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Anulo (page does not exist)")

- @ [anulo dancer](/index.php?title=Anulo_dancer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Anulo dancer (page does not exist)")

- @ [sister](/wiki/Sister "Sister")

- @ [houseless drow](/index.php?title=Houseless_drow\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Houseless drow (page does not exist)")

- & [yochlol](/wiki/Yochlol "Yochlol") and their various forms

  - s demonic black widow
  - @ unearthly drow
  - v stinking cloud

- & [Avatar of Lolth](/wiki/Avatar_of_Lolth "Avatar of Lolth")

### dNetHack racial equipment

The items non-exhaustively listed below are considered to be droven items:

- [droven crossbow](/wiki/Droven_crossbow "Droven crossbow")
- [droven bolt](/wiki/Droven_bolt "Droven bolt")
- [droven spear](/wiki/Droven_spear "Droven spear")
- [droven dagger](/wiki/Droven_dagger "Droven dagger")
- [droven short sword](/wiki/Droven_short_sword "Droven short sword")
- [droven greatsword](/wiki/Droven_greatsword "Droven greatsword")
- [droven lance](/wiki/Droven_lance "Droven lance")
- [droven helm](/wiki/Droven_helm "Droven helm")
- [droven chain mail](/wiki/Droven_chain_mail "Droven chain mail")
- [droven plate mail](/wiki/Droven_plate_mail "Droven plate mail")
- [droven cloak](/wiki/Droven_cloak "Droven cloak")

Droven weapons except for the droven crossbow have a [base material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") of [obsidian](/index.php?title=Obsidian_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Obsidian (dNetHack) (page does not exist)"), which is lighter in [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") than most [metallic](/wiki/Metallic "Metallic") materials, but is [fragile](/wiki/Fragile "Fragile") and shatters if [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") or [fired](/wiki/Fired "Fired") unless it is [fixed](/wiki/Fixed "Fixed"). Droven heavy armor has a base material of [shadowsteel](/wiki/Shadowsteel "Shadowsteel"), which is even lighter and quite durable as armor material, but slowly evaporates upon exposure to light - this can be slowed by [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"), while [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility") prevents degrading or repairing; fixed shadowsteel armor repairs itself while its wearer is in a dark square.

## SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), only the [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(SpliceHack\) "Drow (SpliceHack)") monster and [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#SpliceHack "Drow (starting race)") heroes are considered to be drow, as in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM - similarly, drow characters in SpliceHack are always chaotic and lack distinct undead forms, though elven characters in SpliceHack are also chaotic. Male drow are known as "hedrow".

### SpliceHack racial equipment

The dark elven items that appear in SpliceHack are all derived from [SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM_racial_equipment) with the exception of the [dark elven ring mail](/wiki/Dark_elven_ring_mail "Dark elven ring mail"), which has notable similarities to the dark elven mithril-coat.

## EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), drow monsters are denoted with the `MH_DROW` flag, and have their own undead forms. Drow are considered the same race as elves like in other variants, and have the same allergy to [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") objects as elves do: drow take extra damage from contact with iron, and wearing iron incurs a penalty to [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") and stops normal HP regeneration. Drow are acclimated to life in complete darkness, and many drow monsters have [ultravision](/index.php?title=Ultravision\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ultravision (page does not exist)") and the ability to darken their surroundings; drow heroes likewise possess ultravision, and can use the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") to surround themselves in darkness for 10 power. [Shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and [temples](/wiki/Temple "Temple") attended by a drow [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") or [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") will be dark.

Drow characters that are in a darkened square gain a to-hit bonus of (XL/3 + 2) when attacking using drow weapons, [bare-handed combat](/wiki/Bare-handed_combat "Bare-handed combat") (including [thievery](/index.php?title=Thievery\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Thievery (page does not exist)") & [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts")) or the [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [Shadowblade](/wiki/Shadowblade "Shadowblade"); drow characters in lit squares have a -4 to-hit penalty for the same weapons, and normal HP regeneration is slowed while in a lit area. Non-player drow gain a to-hit bonus of ([ML](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level")/3 + 2) with all weapons in dark squares, and have a -3 to-hit penalty in lit squares.

### List of EvilHack monsters

The monsters non-exhaustively listed below are considered drow:

- s [drider](/index.php?title=Drider_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drider (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- M [drow mummy](/index.php?title=Drow_mummy_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow mummy (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- Z [drow zombie](/wiki/Drow_zombie_\(EvilHack\) "Drow zombie (EvilHack)")
- @ [drow](/index.php?title=Drow_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow raider](/index.php?title=Drow_raider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow raider (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow warrior](/index.php?title=Drow_warrior\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow warrior (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow mage](/index.php?title=Drow_mage\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow mage (page does not exist)")
- @ [drow cleric](/index.php?title=Drow_cleric\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow cleric (page does not exist)")

Drow can also generate as the following [racial monsters](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster"):

- All [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster_\(EvilHack\) "Player monster (EvilHack)") in drow-compatible roles
- @ [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper")
- @ [watchman](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman")
- @ [watch captain](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain")
- @ [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier")
- @ [sergeant](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant")
- @ [lieutenant](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant")
- @ [captain](/wiki/Captain "Captain")
- @ [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")
- @ [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest")

### EvilHack racial equipment

The items non-exhaustively listed below are considered to be dark elven items:

- [dark elven helm](/wiki/Dark_elven_helm "Dark elven helm")
- [dark elven boots](/wiki/Dark_elven_boots "Dark elven boots")
- [dark elven chain mail](/wiki/Dark_elven_chain_mail "Dark elven chain mail")
- [dark elven tunic](/wiki/Dark_elven_tunic "Dark elven tunic")
- [dark elven cloak](/wiki/Dark_elven_cloak "Dark elven cloak")
- [dark elven gloves](/wiki/Dark_elven_gloves "Dark elven gloves")
- [dark elven bracers](/wiki/Dark_elven_bracers "Dark elven bracers")
- [dark elven long sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_long_sword "Dark elven long sword")
- [dark elven short sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(EvilHack\) "Dark elven short sword (EvilHack)")
- [dark elven dagger](/wiki/Dark_elven_dagger_\(EvilHack\) "Dark elven dagger (EvilHack)")
- [dark elven spear](/wiki/Dark_elven_spear "Dark elven spear")
- [dark elven bow](/wiki/Dark_elven_bow_\(EvilHack\) "Dark elven bow (EvilHack)")
- [dark elven arrow](/wiki/Dark_elven_arrow_\(EvilHack\) "Dark elven arrow (EvilHack)")
- [dark elven hand crossbow](/wiki/Dark_elven_hand_crossbow "Dark elven hand crossbow")
- [dark elven crossbow bolt](/wiki/Dark_elven_crossbow_bolt "Dark elven crossbow bolt")

Dark elven armor grants a +1 [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") bonus to drow characters and other drow monsters that wear them, and drow characters can also safely enchant dark elven armor to +7. All dark elven items that are made of [adamantine](/wiki/Adamantine "Adamantine") (i.e. weapons and heavy armor) have a chance of becoming brittle or even dissolving in lit squares: weapons may break when used against or thrown at monsters, while armor will become more and more brittle as take absorb hits.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Drow (monster attribute)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Drow is a monster attribute in some variants of NetHack that indicates when a monster should be considered dark elven. As drow are related to elves, they are also considered elven.

In the variants that it appears in, the drow attribute generally determines the appropriate racial equipment for drow monsters and drow characters, as well as what constitutes cannibalism and same-race sacrifice for drow characters.

Contents

  • 1 SLASH'EM
    • 1.1 SLASH'EM racial equipment
  • 2 dNetHack
    • 2.1 List of dNetHack monsters
    • 2.2 dNetHack racial equipment
  • 3 SpliceHack
    • 3.1 SpliceHack racial equipment
  • 4 EvilHack
    • 4.1 List of EvilHack monsters
    • 4.2 EvilHack racial equipment

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, only the drow monster and drow heroes are considered to be drow - drow characters are always chaotic, since elves in SLASH'EM can be lawful or neutral. Unlike later variants, drow lack distinct undead forms.

All the information in this section also applies to SlashTHEM.

SLASH'EM racial equipment

The following objects are considered dark elven items:

  • dark elven dagger
  • dark elven short sword
  • dark elven bow
  • dark elven arrow
  • dark elven mithril-coat

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, drow monsters are denoted with the MA_DROW flag, and have far more detailed attributes than in other variants.

Drow monsters have a +2 bonus to hit dice size and gain sleep resistance at experience level or monster level 4. Drow monsters that are not mindless can invoke the darkness to cover the area around them, which darkens rooms and otherwise creates unlit squares in a 5-square radius around the user - a drow hero can use this ability via the #monster extended command for 10 power.

Nearly all drow monsters, including heroes but excluding any of the Changed, are generated as belonging to a particular "house" - this can usually be determined by the house symbols engraved on any signet rings and heavy droven armor that they generate with. Drow from houses that are aligned against each other will be mutually hostile, and will be hostile towards a drow hero of an opposing faction - conversely, drow of the same house, or of different houses that are aligned with each other, will be peaceful towards each other and towards drow heroes of allied factions.

Drow monsters gain a +1 bonus to multishot when throwing Sickle Moon, and gain a +1 bonus to the precision damage multiplier for firing projectiles from droven crossbows. Drow monsters cannot cast directed spells at a character that is either non-drow and standing on an Elbereth engraving, or else is a drow and standing on a Lolth engraving with the conditions for its use met. Drow spellcasters that cast the summon insects monster spell will instead use a variation of the spell that summons spiders.

List of dNetHack monsters

The monsters listed below are considered to be drow:

  • h changed
  • h clairvoyant changed
  • C drider
  • 9 Iksh'na Deva
  • C sprow
  • C priestess of Ghaunadaur
  • C Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion
  • C mendicant sprow
  • C mendicant drider
  • H warrior changed
  • H twitching four-armed changed
  • L dokkalfar eternal matriarch
  • M drow mummy
  • M hedrow zombie
  • @ drow
  • @ drow captain
  • @ hedrow warrior
  • @ hedrow wizard
  • @ drow matron
  • @ hedrow blademaster
  • @ embraced drowess
  • @ shadowsmith
  • @ mindless thrall
  • @ Eclavdra
  • @ Mother
  • @ drow novice
  • @ Seyll Auzkovyn
  • @ Daruth Xaxox
  • @ Blibdoolpoolp, graven-into-flesh
  • @ A'gone
  • @ A'salom
  • @ drow matron-mother
  • @ hedrow master-wizard
  • @ drow alienist
  • @ Gromph
  • @ Dantrag
  • @ stjarna-alfr
  • @ Sister T'eirastra
  • @ Pen'a mendicant
  • @ Y-cultist
  • @ Y-cultist fighter
  • @ Y-cultist wizard
  • @ Y-cultist matron
  • @ Y-cultist patron
  • @ anulo
  • @ anulo dancer
  • @ sister
  • @ houseless drow
  • & yochlol and their various forms
    • s demonic black widow
    • @ unearthly drow
    • v stinking cloud
  • & Avatar of Lolth

dNetHack racial equipment

The items non-exhaustively listed below are considered to be droven items:

  • droven crossbow
  • droven bolt
  • droven spear
  • droven dagger
  • droven short sword
  • droven greatsword
  • droven lance
  • droven helm
  • droven chain mail
  • droven plate mail
  • droven cloak

Droven weapons except for the droven crossbow have a base material of obsidian, which is lighter in weight than most metallic materials, but is fragile and shatters if thrown or fired unless it is fixed. Droven heavy armor has a base material of shadowsteel, which is even lighter and quite durable as armor material, but slowly evaporates upon exposure to light - this can be slowed by magic cancellation, while invisibility prevents degrading or repairing; fixed shadowsteel armor repairs itself while its wearer is in a dark square.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, only the drow monster and drow heroes are considered to be drow, as in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM - similarly, drow characters in SpliceHack are always chaotic and lack distinct undead forms, though elven characters in SpliceHack are also chaotic. Male drow are known as "hedrow".

SpliceHack racial equipment

The dark elven items that appear in SpliceHack are all derived from SLASH'EM with the exception of the dark elven ring mail, which has notable similarities to the dark elven mithril-coat.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, drow monsters are denoted with the MH_DROW flag, and have their own undead forms. Drow are considered the same race as elves like in other variants, and have the same allergy to iron objects as elves do: drow take extra damage from contact with iron, and wearing iron incurs a penalty to luck and stops normal HP regeneration. Drow are acclimated to life in complete darkness, and many drow monsters have ultravision and the ability to darken their surroundings; drow heroes likewise possess ultravision, and can use the #monster extended command to surround themselves in darkness for 10 power. Shops and temples attended by a drow shopkeeper or aligned priest will be dark.

Drow characters that are in a darkened square gain a to-hit bonus of (XL/3 + 2) when attacking using drow weapons, bare-handed combat (including thievery & martial arts) or the artifact Shadowblade; drow characters in lit squares have a -4 to-hit penalty for the same weapons, and normal HP regeneration is slowed while in a lit area. Non-player drow gain a to-hit bonus of (ML/3 + 2) with all weapons in dark squares, and have a -3 to-hit penalty in lit squares.

List of EvilHack monsters

The monsters non-exhaustively listed below are considered drow:

  • s drider
  • M drow mummy
  • Z drow zombie
  • @ drow
  • @ drow raider
  • @ drow warrior
  • @ drow mage
  • @ drow cleric

Drow can also generate as the following racial monsters:

  • All player monsters in drow-compatible roles
  • @ shopkeeper
  • @ watchman
  • @ watch captain
  • @ soldier
  • @ sergeant
  • @ lieutenant
  • @ captain
  • @ aligned priest
  • @ high priest

EvilHack racial equipment

The items non-exhaustively listed below are considered to be dark elven items:

  • dark elven helm
  • dark elven boots
  • dark elven chain mail
  • dark elven tunic
  • dark elven cloak
  • dark elven gloves
  • dark elven bracers
  • dark elven long sword
  • dark elven short sword
  • dark elven dagger
  • dark elven spear
  • dark elven bow
  • dark elven arrow
  • dark elven hand crossbow
  • dark elven crossbow bolt

Dark elven armor grants a +1 AC bonus to drow characters and other drow monsters that wear them, and drow characters can also safely enchant dark elven armor to +7. All dark elven items that are made of adamantine (i.e. weapons and heavy armor) have a chance of becoming brittle or even dissolving in lit squares: weapons may break when used against or thrown at monsters, while armor will become more and more brittle as take absorb hits.

rawPage: '''Drow''' is a [[monster attribute]] in some variants of ''[[NetHack]]'' that indicates when a [[monster]] should be considered dark elven. As drow are related to elves, they are also considered [[Elf (monster attribute)|elven]]. In the variants that it appears in, the drow attribute generally determines the appropriate [[racial equipment]] for drow monsters and [[Drow (starting race)|drow]] characters, as well as what constitutes [[cannibalism]] and same-race [[sacrifice]] for drow characters. ==SLASH'EM== In [[SLASH'EM]], only the [[Drow (SLASH'EM)|drow]] monster and [[Drow (starting race)#SLASH'EM|drow]] [[hero]]es are considered to be drow - drow characters are always chaotic, since [[Elf (starting race)|elves]] in SLASH'EM can be lawful or neutral. Unlike later variants, drow lack distinct undead forms. All the information in this section also applies to [[SlashTHEM]]. ===SLASH'EM racial equipment=== The following objects are considered dark elven items: * [[Dark elven dagger (SLASH'EM)|dark elven dagger]] * [[Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)|dark elven short sword]] * [[Dark elven bow (SLASH'EM)|dark elven bow]] * [[Dark elven arrow (SLASH'EM)|dark elven arrow]] * [[dark elven mithril-coat]] ==dNetHack== In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], drow monsters are denoted with the '''MA_DROW''' flag, and have far more detailed attributes than in other variants. Drow monsters have a +2 bonus to [[hit dice]] size and gain [[sleep resistance]] at [[experience level]] or [[monster level]] 4. Drow monsters that are not [[mindless]] can invoke the darkness to cover the area around them, which darkens rooms and otherwise creates unlit squares in a 5-square radius around the user - a [[Drow (starting race)#dNetHack|drow]] hero can use this ability via the [[Monster (command)|#monster]] [[extended command]] for 10 [[power]]. Nearly all drow monsters, including heroes but excluding any of the [[Changed]], are generated as belonging to a particular "house" - this can usually be determined by the house symbols engraved on any [[signet ring]]s and heavy droven armor that they generate with. Drow from houses that are aligned against each other will be mutually hostile, and will be hostile towards a drow hero of an opposing faction - conversely, drow of the same house, or of different houses that are aligned with each other, will be peaceful towards each other and towards drow heroes of allied factions. Drow monsters gain a +1 bonus to [[multishot]] when [[throw]]ing [[dNetHack artifacts#Sickle Moon|Sickle Moon]], and gain a +1 bonus to the precision damage multiplier for firing projectiles from [[droven crossbow]]s. Drow monsters cannot cast directed spells at a character that is either non-drow and standing on an [[Elbereth (dNetHack)|Elbereth]] [[engraving]], or else is a drow and standing on a [[Lolth (dNetHack)|Lolth]] engraving with the conditions for its use met. Drow spellcasters that cast the [[summon insects]] [[monster spell]] will instead use [[dNetHack monster spells|a variation of the spell]] that summons [[spider]]s. ===List of dNetHack monsters=== The monsters listed below are considered to be drow: * {{orange|h}} [[changed]] * {{brightblue|h}} [[clairvoyant changed]] * {{white|C}} [[Drider (dNetHack)|drider]] * {{brightblue|9}} [[Iksh'na Deva]] * {{black|C}} [[sprow]] * {{brightmagenta|C}} [[priestess of Ghaunadaur]] * {{magenta|C}} [[Blibdoolpoolp's mindgraven champion]] * {{blue|C}} [[mendicant sprow]] * {{blue|C}} [[mendicant drider]] * {{orange|H}} [[warrior changed]] * {{orange|H}} [[twitching four-armed changed]] * {{black|L}} [[dokkalfar eternal matriarch]] * {{black|M}} [[Drow mummy (dNetHack)|drow mummy]] * {{black|M}} [[hedrow zombie]] * {{black|@}} [[Drow (dNetHack)|drow]] * {{black|@}} [[drow captain]] * {{black|@}} [[hedrow warrior]] * {{gray|@}} [[hedrow wizard]] * {{black|@}} [[drow matron]] * {{gray|@}} [[hedrow blademaster]] * {{gray|@}} [[embraced drowess]] * {{white|@}} [[shadowsmith]] * {{magenta|@}} [[mindless thrall]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Eclavdra]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Mother (quest leader)|Mother]] * {{black|@}} [[drow novice]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Seyll Auzkovyn]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Daruth Xaxox]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Blibdoolpoolp, graven-into-flesh]] * {{magenta|@}} [[A'gone]] * {{magenta|@}} [[A'salom]] * {{black|@}} [[drow matron-mother]] * {{gray|@}} [[hedrow master-wizard]] * {{gray|@}} [[drow alienist]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Gromph]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Dantrag]] * {{white|@}} [[stjarna-alfr]] * {{magenta|@}} [[Sister T'eirastra]] * {{blue|@}} [[Pen'a mendicant]] * {{black|@}} [[Y-cultist]] * {{black|@}} [[Y-cultist fighter]] * {{gray|@}} [[Y-cultist wizard]] * {{black|@}} [[Y-cultist matron]] * {{gray|@}} [[Y-cultist patron]] * {{black|@}} [[anulo]] * {{black|@}} [[anulo dancer]] * {{white|@}} [[sister]] * {{black|@}} [[houseless drow]] * {{black|&}} [[yochlol]] and their various forms ** {{black|s}} demonic black widow ** {{black|@}} unearthly drow ** {{black|v}} stinking cloud * {{magenta|&}} [[Avatar of Lolth]] ===dNetHack racial equipment=== The items non-exhaustively listed below are considered to be droven items: * [[droven crossbow]] * [[droven bolt]] * [[droven spear]] * [[droven dagger]] * [[droven short sword]] * [[droven greatsword]] * [[droven lance]] * [[droven helm]] * [[droven chain mail]] * [[droven plate mail]] * [[droven cloak]] Droven weapons except for the droven crossbow have a [[Object materials (dNetHack)|base material]] of [[Obsidian (dNetHack)|obsidian]], which is lighter in [[weight]] than most [[metallic]] materials, but is [[fragile]] and shatters if [[thrown]] or [[fired]] unless it is [[fixed]]. Droven heavy armor has a base material of [[shadowsteel]], which is even lighter and quite durable as armor material, but slowly evaporates upon exposure to light - this can be slowed by [[magic cancellation]], while [[invisibility]] prevents degrading or repairing; fixed shadowsteel armor repairs itself while its wearer is in a dark square. ==SpliceHack== In [[SpliceHack]], only the [[Drow (SpliceHack)|drow]] monster and [[Drow (starting race)#SpliceHack|drow]] heroes are considered to be drow, as in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM - similarly, drow characters in SpliceHack are always chaotic and lack distinct undead forms, though elven characters in SpliceHack are also chaotic. Male drow are known as "hedrow". ===SpliceHack racial equipment=== The dark elven items that appear in SpliceHack are all derived from [[#SLASH'EM racial equipment|SLASH'EM]] with the exception of the [[dark elven ring mail]], which has notable similarities to the dark elven mithril-coat. ==EvilHack== In [[EvilHack]], drow monsters are denoted with the '''MH_DROW''' flag, and have their own undead forms. Drow are considered the same race as elves like in other variants, and have the same allergy to [[iron]] objects as elves do: drow take extra damage from contact with iron, and wearing iron incurs a penalty to [[luck]] and stops normal HP regeneration. Drow are acclimated to life in complete darkness, and many drow monsters have [[ultravision]] and the ability to darken their surroundings; drow heroes likewise possess ultravision, and can use the [[Monster (command)|#monster]] [[extended command]] to surround themselves in darkness for 10 power. [[Shop]]s and [[temple]]s attended by a drow [[shopkeeper]] or [[aligned priest]] will be dark. Drow characters that are in a darkened square gain a to-hit bonus of (XL/3 + 2) when attacking using drow weapons, [[bare-handed combat]] (including [[thievery]] & [[martial arts]]) or the [[artifact]] [[Shadowblade]]; drow characters in lit squares have a -4 to-hit penalty for the same weapons, and normal HP regeneration is slowed while in a lit area. Non-player drow gain a to-hit bonus of ([[Monster level|ML]]/3 + 2) with all weapons in dark squares, and have a -3 to-hit penalty in lit squares. ===List of EvilHack monsters=== The monsters non-exhaustively listed below are considered drow: * {{black|s}} [[Drider (EvilHack)|drider]] * {{black|M}} [[Drow mummy (EvilHack)|drow mummy]] * {{black|Z}} [[Drow zombie (EvilHack)|drow zombie]] * {{black|@}} [[Drow (EvilHack)|drow]] * {{black|@}} [[drow raider]] * {{black|@}} [[drow warrior]] * {{black|@}} [[drow mage]] * {{black|@}} [[drow cleric]] Drow can also generate as the following [[racial monster]]s: * All [[Player monster (EvilHack)|player monsters]] in drow-compatible roles * {{monsymlink|shopkeeper}} * {{monsymlink|watchman}} * {{monsymlink|watch captain}} * {{monsymlink|soldier}} * {{monsymlink|sergeant}} * {{monsymlink|lieutenant}} * {{monsymlink|captain}} * {{monsymlink|aligned priest}} * {{monsymlink|high priest}} ===EvilHack racial equipment=== The items non-exhaustively listed below are considered to be dark elven items: * [[dark elven helm]] * [[dark elven boots]] * [[dark elven chain mail]] * [[dark elven tunic]] * [[dark elven cloak]] * [[dark elven gloves]] * [[dark elven bracers]] * [[dark elven long sword]] * [[Dark elven short sword (EvilHack)|dark elven short sword]] * [[Dark elven dagger (EvilHack)|dark elven dagger]] * [[dark elven spear]] * [[Dark elven bow (EvilHack)|dark elven bow]] * [[Dark elven arrow (EvilHack)|dark elven arrow]] * [[dark elven hand crossbow]] * [[dark elven crossbow bolt]] Dark elven armor grants a +1 [[AC]] bonus to drow characters and other drow monsters that wear them, and drow characters can also safely enchant dark elven armor to +7. All dark elven items that are made of [[adamantine]] (i.e. weapons and heavy armor) have a chance of becoming brittle or even dissolving in lit squares: weapons may break when used against or thrown at monsters, while armor will become more and more brittle as take absorb hits. {{slashem-7E7|offset=1}} {{variant-343}} [[Category:SLASH'EM monster attributes]] [[Category:dNetHack monster attributes]] [[Category:SpliceHack monster attributes]] [[Category:notdNetHack monster attributes]] [[Category:EvilHack monster attributes]] [[Category:SlashTHEM monster attributes]] [[Category:notnotdNetHack monster attributes]]
